segments.en: 8. The Interior as Suffering in the Three Times
“Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is suffering,

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītasmiṃ cakkhusmiṃ anapekkho hoti;
segments.en: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple doesn’t worry about the eye of the past,
they don’t look forward to enjoying the eye in the future,

segments.pli: paccuppannassa cakkhussa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
segments.en: and they practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye in the present. …”

segments.pli: Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītāya jivhāya anapekkho hoti;
paccuppannāya jivhāya nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.
Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako atītasmiṃ manasmiṃ anapekkho hoti;
paccuppannassa manassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hotī”ti.

sections.title: “Mendicants, the eye of the past and future is…

suttaplex.blurb: In the past, future, and present, the six interior sense fields are suffering and not-self. When a noble disciple truly sees them like this, they become disillusioned and liberated.
